org.obrel.core

Class IntermediateRelation<T,I>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.obrel.core.RelatedObject
      • org.obrel.core.SerializableRelatedObject
        • org.obrel.core.Relation<T>
          • org.obrel.core.DirectRelation<T>
            • org.obrel.core.IntermediateRelation<T,I>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, Relatable

    public class IntermediateRelation<T,I>
extends DirectRelation<T>
    A relation class that stores the target value in an intermediate format. When the target value is queried it will be created by applying a conversion function to the intermediate value. The converted value is then stored in the superclass DirectRelation and then used for all further target queries.

    Copies of this class will be created by the DirectRelation.copyTo(Relatable) method of the base class DirectRelation that will convert the intermediate value by invoking the method getTarget() and then return a new instance of the base class. Therefore the copy of an intermediate relation will always be a direct relation.

    The serialized format of an intermediate relation depends on the intermediate target value and the conversion function. If both are serializable they will be serialized directly. If one of them is not serializable the intermediate target value will be converted to the final target format which will then be serialized.

    See the documentation of RelatedObject.set(RelationType, Function, Object) for details about this kind of relation.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form
